addPowerUp(uint8).details: The power up ID is the index of the power up in the `rarities` array + 1. The cumulative rarity sum is also increased. Reverts if:   - The rarity exceeds the maximum value of uint8.

params.rarity: The rarity of the power up, lower is more rare, 0 is not available

burnPowerUp(uint256,uint256).details: Reverts if:   - The power up ID is out of bounds (i.e. the power up does not exist).   - The player does not have enough power ups to burn.

params.id: The ID of the power up to burn

constructor.details: Initializes the contract and enables public purchasing.

params.legendCoin_: The address of the LEGEND ERC20 token
params.metadata_: The address of the upgradable metadata contract
params.owner: The owner of the contract. Can be set later with `transferOwnership`.
params.powerUpCost_: The initial cost in LEGEND to purchase a power up

params.powerUpId: The ID of the power up

purchasePowerUp(uint256).details: Reverts if:   - Purchasing is currently disabled.   - Spending LEGEND fails, usually because insufficient balance.

params.amount: The amount of power ups to purchase

returns._0: ids The power up IDs minted to the player

refreshAllMetadata().details: Uses the ERC1155 URI event in a loop which is not ideal, but there's no batch event for this with ERC1155. It might be worth trying `refreshAllMetadata4906` first.

refreshAllMetadata4906().details: This is a workaround for the fact that the ERC1155 URI event does not support batching. Some marketplaces may support the EIP4906 event for ERC1155 batch metadata updates, but it's not guaranteed.

refreshMetadata4906(uint256).details: Some marketplaces may support the EIP4906 event for ERC1155 metadata updates, but it's not guaranteed.

removePowerUp(uint256).details: It does so by setting the rarity to zero, and updating the cumulative rarity sum. Reverts if:   - The power up ID is out of bounds (i.e. the power up does not exist)

params.powerUpId: The ID of the power up to delete

params.legendCoinAddress: The new address for the LEGEND contract

setMetadataAddress(address).details: After updating, you may want to call one of the `refreshMetadata` functions so that marketplaces can update their metadata.

params.metadataAddress: The new address for the metadata contract

params.cost: The new cost of a power up

params.enabled: Whether power ups can be purchased

updatePowerUpRarity(uint256,uint8).details: It does so by updating the rarity in the `rarities` array, and updating the cumulative rarity sum. Reverts if:   - The power up ID is out of bounds (i.e. the power up does not exist)   - The new rarity exceeds the maximum value of uint8.

params.powerUpId: The ID of the power up to update
params.rarity: The new rarity of the power up, lower is more rare, 0 is not available

addPowerUp(uint8).notice: Add a new power up to the list of available power ups.

getNextPowerUpId().notice: Get the next power up ID that will be added.

getPowerUpExists(uint256).notice: Check if a power up exists.

getPowerUpRarity(uint256).notice: Get the rarity of a power up.

getTotalActivePowerUps().notice: Get the total number of active power ups.

getTotalPowerUps().notice: Get the total number of power ups.

powerUpCost().notice: The cost in LEGEND to purchase a power up

purchasePowerUp(uint256).notice: Purchase a random Legend Maps Power Up with LEGEND ERC20 tokens.

randomPowerUpId(uint256).notice: Generate a random power up ID from all available power ups.

refreshAllMetadata().notice: Refresh the metadata for all token IDs

refreshAllMetadata4906().notice: Refresh the metadata for all token IDs using EIP4906

refreshMetadata(uint256).notice: Refresh the metadata for a specific token ID

refreshMetadata4906(uint256).notice: Refresh the metadata for a specific token ID using EIP4906

removePowerUp(uint256).notice: Remove a power up from the list of available power ups.

setLegendCoinAddress(address).notice: Sets the address of the LEGEND ERC20 token

setPowerUpCost(uint256).notice: Set the cost of a power up in LEGEND ERC20 tokens

setPurchasingEnabled(bool).notice: Set the public purchasing status of power ups

updatePowerUpRarity(uint256,uint8).notice: Update the rarity of a power up.
